intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius abellense, commonly known as the Bell's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant features basal rosettes of leaves and produces yellow composite flowers in the summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges, and the stems are hairy. Hieracium abellense is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
